Class ComplexShape

  • java.lang.Object
    • Shape2D
      • ComplexShape
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Translatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Parallelogram, Trapezoid, Triangle

    abstract class ComplexShape
extends Shape2D
implements Translatable
    [ComplexShape.java] The class is an abstract class that holds the basic information of all complex shapes available to the user. These complex shapes include triangles, trapezoids, parallelograms and rhombuses. All complex shapes have an array of coordinates and number of sides.
    Version:
    1.0, Oct 9, 2020
    Author:
    Braydon Wang

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) abstract void calculateArea()
      An abstract method that enforces the calculation of the shape's area.
      (package private) abstract void calculatePerimeter()
      An abstract method that enforces the calculation of the shape's perimeter.
      int getNumberOfSides()
      This method returns the number of sides that the shape has.
      int[] getXCoordinates()
      This method returns the array that holds all of the shape's x coordinates.
      int[] getYCoordinates()
      This method returns the array that holds all of the shape's y coordinates.

      This method sets the new x coordinate at the specified index.
      void setYCoordinates(int y, int ind)
      This method sets the new y coordinate at the specified index.
      void translate(int horizontal, int vertical)
      This method translates every coordinate in the array by a horizontal and vertical shift.
